headline: Meta Earnings, Fed Decision, Venezuela Testimony: Still to Come This Week
summary: Earnings season is in full throttle, with results expected from a quartet of tech giants—Apple, Meta Platforms, Microsoft and Tesla. In Washington, the Federal Reserve will announce its first interest-rate decision of 2026.

headline: GE Vernova Falls After Earnings. Guidance Boost Isn’t Enough to Lift the Stock.
summary: GE Vernova  reported solid fourth-quarter numbers, but the real show was guidance.  Ebitda was a little light, but orders at $22.2 billion far exceeded sales.  GE Vernova increased 2026 sales guidance to a midpoint of $44.5 billion, up from $41.5 billion, and 2028 sales guidance to about $56 billion, up from $52 billion.

content.title: GE Vernova Falls After Earnings. Guidance Boost Isn’t Enough to Lift the Stock.
content.summary: GE Vernova  reported solid fourth-quarter numbers, but the real show was guidance.  Ebitda was a little light, but orders at $22.2 billion far exceeded sales.  GE Vernova increased 2026 sales guidance to a midpoint of $44.5 billion, up from $41.5 billion, and 2028 sales guidance to about $56 billion, up from $52 billion.

headline: GE Vernova Raises 2026 And 2028 Outlook For These Reasons; S&P 500 Stock Falls
summary: GE Vernova early Wednesday raised its 2026 outlook, while also hiking its 2028 guidance, as it reported fourth-quarter earnings.  GEV stock fell before the stock market open after rallying 4% Tuesday, within a base and near an early entry.  GE Vernova saw diluted earnings balloon to $13.39 per share, up from $1.73 per share a year ago and well above the $3.28 expectation.

content.title: GE Vernova Raises 2026 And 2028 Outlook For These Reasons; S&P 500 Stock Falls
content.summary: GE Vernova early Wednesday raised its 2026 outlook, while also hiking its 2028 guidance, as it reported fourth-quarter earnings.  GEV stock fell before the stock market open after rallying 4% Tuesday, within a base and near an early entry.  GE Vernova saw diluted earnings balloon to $13.39 per share, up from $1.73 per share a year ago and well above the $3.28 expectation.

headline: GE Vernova shares rise on strong revenue beat, raised outlook
summary: Investing.com -- GE Vernova Inc. (NYSE: GEV) shares jumped 5.2% after the energy transition company reported fourth quarter revenue that exceeded analyst expectations and raised its financial outlook following the acquisition of Prolec GE.

content.title: GE Vernova shares rise on strong revenue beat, raised outlook
content.summary: Investing.com -- GE Vernova Inc. (NYSE: GEV) shares jumped 5.2% after the energy transition company reported fourth quarter revenue that exceeded analyst expectations and raised its financial outlook following the acquisition of Prolec GE.

headline: GE Vernova: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of nine analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $3.05 per share. The the energy business spun off from General Electric posted revenue of $10.96 billion in the period, also topping Street forecasts. Eight analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $10.08 billion.

content.title: GE Vernova: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: The average estimate of nine analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $3.05 per share. The the energy business spun off from General Electric posted revenue of $10.96 billion in the period, also topping Street forecasts. Eight analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $10.08 billion.

headline: China approves Nvidia H200 purchases, Starbucks US sales rise
summary: Morning Brief Host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including semiconductor stock reactions after China approves the purchase of Nvidia's (NVDA) H200 chips, Starbucks (SBUX) shares jumping on rising US sales, and GE Vernova (GEV) raising its guidance.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: GE Vernova (NYSE:GEV) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q4 CY2025
summary: Energy transition company GE Vernova (NYSE:GEV) reported revenue ahead of Wall Streets expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 3.8% year on year to $10.96 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $44.5 billion at the midpoint came in 6.3% above analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $13.39 per share was significantly above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: GE Vernova (NYSE:GEV) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q4 CY2025
content.summary: Energy transition company GE Vernova (NYSE:GEV) reported revenue ahead of Wall Streets expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 3.8% year on year to $10.96 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $44.5 billion at the midpoint came in 6.3% above analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $13.39 per share was significantly above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: GE Vernova Raises 2026 And 2028 Outlook For These Reasons; Above Early Entry
summary: GE Vernova early Wednesday raised its 2026 outlook, while also hiking its 2028 guidance, as it reported fourth-quarter earnings.  GEV stock slipped shortly after the stock market open, but remains above an early entry of 698.74.  GE Vernova saw diluted earnings balloon to $13.39 per share, up from $1.73 per share a year ago and well above the $3.28 expectation.

content.title: GE Vernova Raises 2026 And 2028 Outlook For These Reasons; Above Early Entry
content.summary: GE Vernova early Wednesday raised its 2026 outlook, while also hiking its 2028 guidance, as it reported fourth-quarter earnings.  GEV stock slipped shortly after the stock market open, but remains above an early entry of 698.74.  GE Vernova saw diluted earnings balloon to $13.39 per share, up from $1.73 per share a year ago and well above the $3.28 expectation.

headline: GE Vernova Stock Lurches as Wind Warning Overshadows Earnings
summary: The turbine maker's wind division recorded higher-than-expected losses last quarter, after the government issued a stop-work order for offshore wind projects, including Vineyard Wind 1 off Massachusetts.  GE Vernova hopes construction can resume soon, after a federal judge struck down the decision to halt work.  “At the end of March, we’ll lose access to the vessel required to complete installation of the remaining turbines,” Chief Financial Officer Ken Parks said.

content.title: GE Vernova Stock Lurches as Wind Warning Overshadows Earnings
content.summary: The turbine maker's wind division recorded higher-than-expected losses last quarter, after the government issued a stop-work order for offshore wind projects, including Vineyard Wind 1 off Massachusetts.  GE Vernova hopes construction can resume soon, after a federal judge struck down the decision to halt work.  “At the end of March, we’ll lose access to the vessel required to complete installation of the remaining turbines,” Chief Financial Officer Ken Parks said.

headline: GE Vernova Warns Efforts to Halt Offshore Wind Projects Could Hurt Operations
summary: GE Vernova warned that the Trump administration’s efforts to halt construction of all U.S. offshore wind projects could hurt its wind division.
